title: Airline and Airport operations
overview: This comprehensive course in Aviation Resource Management offers a blend of theoretical knowledge and practical skills essential for managing resources in the aviation industry. Designed for students and professionals in engineering, technology, management, and science domains, the curriculum covers various aspects of resource management, including human resources, financial management, operational assets, and risk management in aviation settings. Through a mix of lectures, case studies, and hands-on sessions, students will learn to apply modern management principles to the unique challenges of the aviation industry. The course also incorporates the latest industry trends and technologies, preparing participants for successful careers in aviation management. By the end of the course, students will have a thorough understanding of how to optimize aviation operations, improve efficiency, and contribute to the safety and profitability of aviation enterprises.
whatWillILearn: Analyze and apply the principles of airline and airport operations in various real-world scenarios.
Design and implement effective passenger and cargo handling strategies to improve operational efficiency.
Evaluate and manage safety and security measures in compliance with aviation regulations.

curriculum.chapter_name: Introduction to Airline and Airport Operations

instructor.about: I'm Angela, I'm a developer with a passion for teaching. I'm the lead instructor at the London App Brewery, London's leading Programming Bootcamp. I've helped hundreds of thousands of students learn to code and change their lives by becoming a developer. I've been invited by companies such as Twitter, Facebook and Google to teach their employees. My first foray into programming was when I was just 12 years old, wanting to build my own Space Invader game. Since then, I've made hundred of websites, apps and games. But most importantly, I realised that my greatest passion is teaching. I spend most of my time researching how to make learning to code fun and make hard concepts easy to understand. I apply everything I discover into my bootcamp courses. In my courses, you'll find lots of geeky humour but also lots of explanations and animations to make sure everything is easy to understand. I'll be there for you every step of the way.

faqs.question: Is this going to be a helpful course.
faqs.answer: Defenately Yes.

faqs.question: What I an going to learn from this corse?
faqs.answer: Web developt realted suff and how to do code.

faqs.question: Can I earn money with freelancing after this?
faqs.answer: Yes its a job ready course.

reviews.review: Python being my first programming language, I was a bit apprehensive about how challenging it might be. However, Angela's teaching style and the way she structured the course made it so easy to understand and enjoyable to
A Really good and comprehensive course. Angel explains things very well and really knows her stuff. And with a subtle but engaging sense of humour.

title: Corporate Insurance Management
overview: This course is meticulously designed to bridge the gap between traditional insurance management theories and the modern-day requirements of the corporate insurance sector, emphasizing technological advancements. It covers a broad spectrum of topics from the basics of corporate insurance, risk management, and policy design to the application of cloud computing, data analytics, and systems design in creating innovative insurance solutions. Through a blend of theoretical knowledge and practical exercises, students will gain firsthand experience in handling real-world insurance challenges. The curriculum is structured to foster critical thinking, problem-solving, and decision-making skills essential for navigating the complexities of the insurance industry.
whatWillILearn: You will Analyze and evaluate various types of corporate insurance policies and their applicability to different organizational risks.
Design and implement risk management strategies using cloud computing and systems design principles.
Apply data analytics tools to interpret insurance data and forecast future trends.

lessons.lesson_name: Understand the basics of corporate insurance
Learn risk assessment and management in corporate context
Gain knowledge on various insurance products and policies
Understand the legal and regulatory framework
Learn the process and challenges of claims management

title: Disaster Risk Reduction.
overview: This course offers an interdisciplinary approach to integrating disaster risk reduction (DRR) with development planning to enhance resilience and reduce vulnerabilities in various contexts. It covers the principles of disaster risk management, sustainable development, and climate change adaptation, emphasizing the importance of incorporating risk assessment and mitigation strategies into development projects and policies. Through a mix of theoretical concepts and hands-on sessions, students will learn to apply DRR strategies, use GIS and remote sensing for risk analysis, and develop comprehensive disaster management and development plans. The curriculum is designed to equip students with the skills to address the challenges of reducing disaster risk in the context of global environmental change and to promote sustainable development goals (SDGs). By the end of the course, participants will have a deep understanding of the complexities of disaster risk and development planning and the competencies to develop integrated solutions that enhance resilience and sustainability.
whatWillILearn: Analyze and interpret disaster risk scenarios using GIS and remote sensing data.
Design and implement risk reduction and sustainable development strategies.
Integrate climate change adaptation measures into development planning.

lessons.lesson_name: The Role of Governance in DRR

curriculum.chapter_name: Integration of DRR and Sustainable Development

lessons.lesson_name: Impacts of Climate Change on Disaster Risks

title: Event-Planning
overview: This course offers an in-depth exploration into the multifaceted world of event planning, covering the essentials of conceptualization, planning, execution, and evaluation of various events. Students will learn through a combination of lectures, hands-on projects, and case studies, gaining knowledge on topics ranging from venue selection, budgeting, marketing, and technology use in events to stakeholder management and post-event analysis. By the end of this course, students will be capable of managing events of any scale, from corporate conferences to grand weddings, ensuring they meet the objectives, budget, and expectations of clients and stakeholders alike. The curriculum is designed to reflect current industry standards and trends, ensuring students gain relevant and actionable skills. With a focus on experiential learning, students will undertake projects and assignments that simulate real-world event planning scenarios, preparing them for successful careers in the event management industry.
whatWillILearn: You will somethingAnalyze and conceptualize event requirements and objectives to create innovative event proposals.
Design and execute comprehensive event plans, including timelines, budgets, marketing strategies, and technology integrations.
Manage and coordinate with vendors, sponsors, and stakeholders to ensure seamless event execution.

lessons.lesson_name: Roles and Responsibilities of an Event Planner
Overview of the Event Planning Process
Tools and Techniques for Event Project Management

title: Investment Management
overview: This comprehensive course on Investment Management is designed to equip students and fresh graduates, particularly those pursuing or having completed degrees in Technology and Management, with the essential skills and knowledge required to excel in the dynamic field of investment management. Integrating theoretical foundations with extensive hands-on practice, the curriculum covers a wide range of topics, from the basics of investment theory to advanced strategies used by professionals in the field. Students will learn how to analyze financial markets, assess investment opportunities, and manage investment portfolios to maximize returns while minimizing risks. The course includes real-world case studies, cutting-edge tools and software for investment analysis, and interactive sessions with industry experts to prepare participants for successful careers in investment management. By the end of this course, students will have a deep understanding of how to apply technology and management principles to solve complex investment problems, making them valuable assets in the global financial industry.
whatWillILearn: Analyze and interpret financial statements to identify investment opportunities using advanced quantitative techniques.
Design and manage diversified investment portfolios considering different financial instruments, risk profiles, and investment goals.
Employ strategic asset allocation and rebalancing techniques to optimize returns and minimize risks.

title: Banking and financial services management
overview: This course is designed to equip students with the skills and knowledge required to excel in the banking and financial services industry. Covering a wide range of topics from the basics of banking operations to advanced financial management techniques, it combines theoretical concepts with practical applications to ensure students are job-ready upon completion. Students will learn about modern banking technology, financial analysis, risk management, regulatory frameworks, and customer service excellence. Through hands-on sessions, case studies, and capstone projects, learners will gain real-world insights into the challenges and opportunities in the financial services sector. This curriculum is structured to foster critical thinking, problem-solving, and decision-making skills essential for a successful career in banking and finance.
whatWillILearn: Analyze and interpret financial statements to assess the health of a banking institution.
Design and implement risk management strategies to mitigate financial and operational risks.
Apply regulatory and compliance guidelines effectively in banking operations.

curriculum.chapter_name: Introduction to Banking and Financial Services

lessons.lesson_name: Market Risk: Interest Rates, Currency Exchange

title: Logistic management
overview: This Advanced Certificate Course in Logistic Management is designed to equip students with the essential skills and knowledge required to excel in the field of logistics and supply chain management. Combining 45 to 60 hours of expert-led lectures with hands-on practical sessions, the course covers the latest trends, technologies, and strategies in logistic management. Students will learn to analyze and optimize logistic operations, implement efficient supply chain strategies, and utilize logistic software. The curriculum is structured to ensure a deep understanding of logistic principles, application of technology in logistics, and the development of strategic decision-making skills. Through real-world case studies, software tools application, and project-based learning, students will be prepared to address complex logistic challenges in a global context.
whatWillILearn: Analyze and optimize logistics and supply chain processes using contemporary methodologies.
Implement effective inventory management, warehousing, and distribution strategies to enhance operational efficiency.
Utilize logistic management software tools for planning, forecasting, and execution of logistic operations.

lessons.lesson_name: Global Supply Chain Challenges and Strategies

title: Operations management
overview: This course delves into the intricate world of operations management, focusing on the essential strategies, techniques, and tools that drive efficiency and innovation in business operations. Designed for ambitious students and fresh graduates from management and STEM backgrounds, the curriculum bridges theoretical concepts with real-world applications through a hands-on approach. Participants will explore key areas including process analysis, quality management, supply chain optimization, project management, and lean operations. The course integrates cutting-edge software tools and frameworks, enabling students to tackle operational challenges with confidence. By the end of this journey, learners will have mastered the art of enhancing productivity, ensuring quality, and fostering innovation in various organizational contexts.
whatWillILearn: Analyze and improve operational processes using quantitative and qualitative methods.
Design and optimize supply chains for enhanced efficiency and sustainability.
Implement quality management practices to improve product and service standards.

title: Performance Marketing
overview: This course offers an in-depth exploration of Performance Marketing, focusing on maximizing ROI through data-driven strategies and techniques. Students will learn to design, implement, and optimize campaigns across various digital platforms, including search engines, social media, and email marketing. The curriculum emphasizes hands-on learning, with practical sessions allowing students to apply theoretical concepts in real-world scenarios. From setting up PPC campaigns to analyzing performance data with Google Analytics, the course covers essential tools and frameworks used by industry professionals. By the end, participants will have mastered the art of creating cost-effective and high-performing marketing campaigns tailored to specific target audiences and business goals.
whatWillILearn: Analyze and interpret performance data to make informed marketing decisions.
Design and implement PPC campaigns that maximize ROI across various platforms.
Optimize digital content for SEO to improve visibility and rankings in search engine results.
